Title: the love spell potential

Scene: Lucy climbs out of bathroom window to find a locked gate.
Bernadette: No husbands, no boyfriends, no rules.
Fine. No husbands, no boyfriends, some rules.
I got a sexy new tube top that says come hither, and a can of pepper spray that says close enough, Jack.
Long story short, she’s on the No Fly List and we might have been followed here by a drone.
I say we attack the big one.
Come on, mama wants a pair of dead ogres.
This may be the potion talking, but you are one fine-ass dungeon master.
Ooh! Come on, back me up here.
Okay, I cast a love spell on Sheldon and Amy.
Penny: I got a brand-new bikini, so drinks at the pool are on these.
Oh, it’s not so bad. You lost money, you’re filled with shame and you got groped by a stranger. I mean, that’s Vegas, you nailed it.
Oh, don’t worry, sweetie. No one has.
Oh, this isn’t alcohol. It’s a magic potion that makes me like you.
You know what? Give me the dice, I want to roll.
Yeah, well I’m supposed to be in Vegas throwing up on a shrimp buffet. Now give it. All right, what do I need?
Fifteen’s the point, the point is fifteen. Give the little lady some room, here it is, coming out. Sixteen! Yes! Oh, please tell me we’re playing for money.
Pretend he’s that TSA agent. Come on.
Ooh, I have an idea. Since it’s not happening any time soon, why don’t your character and your character do it in the game?
Okay, we just want to say, we feel really bad about…
Amy: No rules? We’re not gonna get drunk and have a six-way with the Blue Man Group, are we?
So there are some rules.
Thank you. Vegas!
I got some old underwear I’m gonna throw on stage at the Garth Brooks concert.
‘Cause last time I saw him, I threw new ones and it got me nothing.
Uh, well, when we were going through security, I got pulled out of line for a pat-down. The, uh, TSA agent got a little handsy. I may have broken her nose with my elbow.
I’m sorry. I feel like such an idiot.
You guys enjoy your evening. I’m gonna go before I ruin anybody else’s weekend.
Okay.
Nineteen. Yes, this is turning out to be even better than Vegas.
Here we go. Fifteen?
Sheldon, they’re talking about sex.
I don’t like this.
What?
You don’t have to come in here and cheer me up.
I’ll tell you what they think. They think our relationship is a joke.
Sheldon, are we ever going to have an intimate relationship?
And now?
Do you have any interest now?
Wow. Talk dirty to me.
I guess I know that. It’s just, part of me wants more.
Come on. Let’s go back out there.
Okay.
Oh.
I kiss you on the lips.
I remove your armour. What do you do?
Keep rolling.
Go away! Sheldon is nibbling on my (sound of dice) 14! Yes!
Howard: The ladies are away, the boys will play.
Come on, are we gonna sit around chatting like a bunch of teenage girls, or are we gonna play D&D like a bunch of teenage boys who are never gonna have sex with those teenage girls?
Isn’t every conversation you two have awkward?
Ready whenever you guys are.

Okay, here we go. You find yourselves in an overgrown old forest. Before you is a giant oak tree with a face on it that looks a lot like Nicolas Cage. He says, (Nicolas Cage voice) Travel with caution. These woods are home to the bones of many a fallen hero.

We’ll be fine, watch. Suddenly, a spectral shape rises from Koothrappali’s bloody corpse, and says, (Raj voice) don’t worry, buddies, ghost Raj will help guide you through the forest. (Nicolas Cage voice) Well, I’m just a tree, but if I were you, I’d listen to your ghost friend.
Uh, it does. (Creaking sound)
What are you doing back?
A satanic fungus that looks suspiciously like Al Pacino rises from the forest floor and says, (Al Pacino voice) You’re playing D&D. You’re playing D&D. This whole apartment is playing D&D.
Okay, here we go. You find yourselves face-to-face with two hulking ogres. What are you doing in our dungeon? You shall die!
What do you do?
The dungeon master’s supposed to roll.
Uh, fifteen or higher.
Seventeen, the larger ogre is dead. The-the other ogre says, you killed my brother, now Ogre Thanksgiving is ruined.
The dragon falls from the sky, crashing into the volcano.
But wait., he’s not dead. He crawls out, spreads his wings and prepares to attack.
Fine. (Christopher Walken voice) You’d think, after all these years, I’d know not to fly over volcanoes. I’m a freaking idiot.
It’s a hit. The dragon collapses to the ground.
Mother? Is that you? Your little boy is coming home.
Oh, yeah? Well, when we get home, I’m gonna take you on a whole different adventure.
Oh.

The love spell takes effect. When Sheldon looks at Amy, she is the most beautiful half-orc he’s ever seen, and he’s overcome with a desire to rip her armour off and gaze fondly at her four hairy breasts. When Amy sees Sheldon, he looks, well, just like Sheldon, ’cause apparently she’s into that. What do you do?
Raj: Anything can happen.
I got my new bloodthirsty savage warrior who will lay waste to all who stand before him. And I had a sensible salad for lunch, so I can eat all the pizza I want.
I’m actually glad Lucy had to work tonight. Saved me the awkward conversation about how I was gonna be hanging with my bros.
Painfully so. We have this rule on the phone that if no one talks for three minutes, you can just hang up. So into her.

Hey, come on, guys, focus. Um, uh, oh, mighty Nicolas Cage tree, we thank you for your warning, but we are brave warriors, and nothing short of death will keep us from our goal. (Text sound) Oh, Lucy’s free after all. See ya.
You’re right, I should finish the game. I take my plus-one long sword, stab myself in the face with it. I’m dead, I’ve got a date with a girl. Bye.
I’m very happy you were able to hang out tonight.
Not that it’s up to you to make me happy. Uh, well, unless you find neediness sexy. In which case, you’re about to have dinner with the hottest man on the planet.
Really?
I, uh, I’m sorry to put you through that.
What else have you been thinking about doing?
I like your bangs.
What else?
Mm, yeah. Those are both toughies.
How are your crab cakes?
That’s great.
No, no. Uh, you’ve always wanted to send your food back in a restaurant, here’s your chance.
Don’t be ridiculous. Waiter?
Hold on. Isn’t there something else you wanted to tell him?
Don’t be silly. Just tell him.
Uh, yeah, sorry. She’s just a little shy. The first time we met, she was so nervous, she climbed out a bathroom window to get away from me.
Lucy?
You don’t know me very well, but each time you crawl out a bathroom window to escape my company, it chips away at my masculinity.
Why would you leave like that?
Okay, if I upset you, then why didn’t you just say something?
Yeah, well, I like you a lot, and that’s scary for me. Mostly because you’re a proven flight risk.
Well, uh, for one thing, you have bigger emotional problems than I do, and I find that very attractive in a woman. I, I don’t know. I just, I think you’re wonderful.
Leonard: I’ve got my helm of lordly might, my boots of speed, and if things get too exciting, my inhaler of asthma.
Oh, that’s nice. But relax, sometimes change is good. Uh, you were worried about Zachary Quinto being the new Spock, but you wound up liking him.
See, Howard’s just as good a dungeon master as I am.
Hey, hey, hey, you can’t leave. We just started.
I push my shoulder against the secret door to see if it gives way.
Hey, I always did sound effects. A-A swarm of bloodthirsty bats fly through the dungeon. (Clicking sounds) Uh, uh, they attack a nearby unicorn. (Strange howl)
No, no, no, Amy, wait. I know it’s not the night you had in mind, but why don’t you guys stay and play with us? It’ll be fun.
What’s the big deal? Raj bailed, so we could use some extra players.
All right, Amy, there’s one ogre left. Take him out.
All right, Amy, it’s your turn. We need one more hit. Finish him off.
Ooh! Sorry, I thought you were gonna do that.
Hey, you guys have been in there for a while. You doing okay?
Sheldon: Dungeons & Dragons.
I’ve got a brand-new seven piece set of polyhedral dice. Hello, new dice smell.
Yeah, yeah, we’ll be right there. Leonard?
I’m not sure how I feel about Howard being dungeon master instead of you.

Oh, please. Every time the topic of change comes up, you throw Zachary Quinto in my face. I’m upset the mailman has a new haircut, Zachary Quinto. I’m upset that daylight saving time started, Zachary Quinto. I’m upset daylight saving time ended, Zachary Quinto. I’m saying this for the last time, Zachary Quinto was a weird, wonderful, unrepeatable event. So stop using him against me.
As good? You just got pantsed in the schoolyard, four-eyes.
Go on, give him your lunch money.
He does sound effects, too!
Okay, well, I have a sound effect for those sound effects. (Blows raspberry)
Ah, that’s my girl.
It would? Fun? Okay, three weeks ago you bought crunchy peanut butter, now you want the girls to play D&D? Do you have a drug problem?
Well, I’ve just never played Dungeons & Dragons with girls before.
I’ll leave it up to the dungeon master.
Yeah, we, now, Penny, we don’t consume alcohol during Dungeons & Dragons. It impairs our judgment.
Okay, literal goose bumps. Look.
I ready my quarter-staff.
Oh, even better than money. You gained experience points.
That is amazing. He made me care about the ogre.
Yay!
Yeah, uh, wait. Doesn’t he say something first? You know, maybe in the voice of a beloved celebrity?
The dragon’s Christopher Walken. That’s perfect.
Wait. Wait. And says?
Oh, I don’t know about you guys, but I have been through the emotional wringer tonight.
Another quest by Wolowitz? Count me in.
Oh, then I’m out.
You see what happens when you let girls play D&D?
I’ve never knocked on my own door before. That was a wild ride.
Thank you. Would you go tell everyone else that? Because they sure think otherwise.
Well, I don’t think our relationship is a joke. I think “a horse goes into a bar, bartender says, why the long face?’, that’s a joke. It’s a good one, too, because a horse has a long face.
Oh, my. That’s an uncomfortable topic. Amy, before I met you, I never had any interest in being intimate with anyone.
And now what?
I have not ruled it out.
I know it doesn’t seem like it to you, but, for me, what we have is extremely intimate.
More? I mean, look at us. It’s only been three years, here we are in bed together.
Well, no. Hold on. My Elven magic-user and your half-orc warrior did have a love spell cast on them. We wouldn’t really be playing the game right if we didn’t see that through.
I believe that, uh, we just killed a dragon. While the others pillage the corpse, I lead you to a secluded area where I attempt to remove your leather armour. (Rolls dice) It comes off.
What do you do?
I kiss you back on the (Rolls dice) lips as well. Your turn.
I erotically caress your (Rolls dice) nose.
Boys: The Dungeon of Mofooskay-Heeko! The Dungeon of Mofooskay-Heeko! The Dungeon of Mofooskay-Heeko!
Lucy: Me, too.
Can I tell you something? I was so nervous about seeing you, before I left my apartment, I put roll-on antiperspirant all over my body.
Yeah. If sweat starts squirting out the top of my head, you’ll know why.
Oh, it’s okay. I’ve been trying to force myself to do things that make me scared.
Well, let’s see. I’d love to be able to tell the lady who cuts my hair that I don’t like bangs.
Oh, thanks, I like ’em, too.
Mmm, it’s kind of a tie between sending food back in a restaurant and saying no to those kids who sell magazines door-to-door.
I know. I have a two-year subscription to Guns & Ammo.53
Kind of funky.
It is? Does funky mean something different in India?
Mmm, it’s okay. I just won’t eat ’em.
Uh, yeah. Everything all right with you?
‘Kay, thanks, bye.
N-No, it, it’s fine. Uh, He’s from a different country, he doesn’t understand our ways.
I have to go to the bathroom. And it’s not because the crab cakes are funky.
Uh-oh. (Dials phone) Hey, Raj. Funny story.
Hey. Long time no see.
I’m sorry.
You were pushing me. I clearly didn’t want to send my food back, and you tried to make me do it anyway.
Well, how can I tell you I’m upset if I can’t tell the woman at Supercuts that my forehead’s my best feature? It’s scary.
How could you like me a lot?
I’m sweating out of my head.
Sheldon (off): (Knock, knock, knock) Amy. (Knock, knock, knock) Amy. (Knock, knock, knock) Amy.

The love spell takes effect. (Knock, knock, knock) Amy. (Knock, knock, knock) Amy. (Knock, knock, knock) Amy.
I’ve never knocked on my own door before. That was a wild ride.
You don’t have to come in here and cheer me up.
Thank you. Would you go tell everyone else that? Because they sure think otherwise.
I’ll tell you what they think. They think our relationship is a joke.

Do you have any interest now?
I have not ruled it out.
